page.title: 02Farming. Barbridge.
page.content: The average farm is 80 acres,with 60 cows and young stock,herringbone milking parlour,self-feed silage clamp,cubicle house for stock in winter and a slurry lagoon. Very little hay made mostly silage.Since imposition of milk quotas,30% less cattle-cake fed,emphasis on making use of good grass,using up to 0.5 tonne artificial fertiliser per acre.Average milk yield 5200 litres sold per annum per cow at 15.8p/litre.One tonne of cake costs about Â£135 + 0.5 tonne of fertiliser at about Â£120/tonne used. More farmers use contractors for silage making, emptying lagoons and hedge-cutting,due to high cost of machinery.40% farms rented,60% owner occupied.The concentration of dairy cows locally is the greatest in the world,being 2.2 cows per hectare.
